article_text: But while the trend seems to be taking hold on the Missouri side of the state line, most Johnson County school districts have been unaffected. Only one district, De Soto, uses a temporary employment agency, but it has done so since 2007 — well before the health insurance law was even considered by Congress.

article_metadata.title: With eyes on the bottom line, some school districts turn to private substitutes when vacancies arise | The Kansas City Star

article_summary:
Only one district, De Soto, uses a temporary employment agency, but it has done so since 2007 — well before the health insurance law was even considered by Congress.
But while the trend seems to be taking hold on the Missouri side of the state line, most Johnson County school districts have been unaffected.
